meta.name: description
meta.content: During the extended school closure, Aurora Public Schools will be distributing FREE breakfast, lunch and dinner. These meals will be provided at 16 locations to ALL children and adults. All three meals, which include vegetarian options, will be available together for pickup through a grab-and-go system. Thanks to generous philanthropic support, we are now able to provide meals to everyone including adults.

header.h1: APS Offers FREE Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner to Students AND Adults During Extended Closure

p.b: PLEASE NOTE: The current stay-at-home order from the Tri-County Health Department does NOT affect our free meal program. Read more here.

p.span: During the extended school closure, Aurora Public Schools will be distributing

breakfast, lunch and dinner. These meals will be provided at 16 locations. All three meals, which include vegetarian options, will be available together for pickup through a grab-and-go system. Thanks to generous philanthropic support, we are now able to provide meals to everyone including adults.

Meals will be available Monday through Friday until further notice at the following locations and times. APS is providing meals at as many locations as possible to reduce travel distances for families. You will notice that the windows for meal pick up are 25 minutes long. Although this may seem short, we believe this window will allow us to provide for a grab-and-go system while also helping us maximize the number of pick-up locations and serve the highest number of families throughout the district.
Please note the starting time for the location that is nearest to your home. Here is a

a.span: map of the meal distribution sites in Aurora

p.b: Town Center at Aurora (Outside the Food Court)

img.data-image-title: APS Free Meal Program During Exrended Break flyer – English updated 5

p.span: In accordance with Federal law and U.S. Department of Agriculture policy, this institution is prohibited from discriminating on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age or disability. USDA is an equal opportunity provider and employer. For more information,

In addition, the statewide Food Resource Hotline is a bilingual toll-free number that connects Coloradans to needed food and nutrition resources. Call the bilingual Food Resource Hotline at 720-382-2920. It is open Monday through Friday from 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Messages left after-hours or on a weekend will be returned the next business day. (If you are hearing impaired, call Relay Colorado at 7-1-1 or 1-800-659-2656.)
that we will continue to keep updated. You may access this communication by clicking on the COVID-19 banner on our website at

I appreciate all of your patience and understanding throughout the past few weeks. In times like these, it is critical for each of us to do our part in taking care of ourselves, our families and our community. The collective strength of the APS community inspires me every day and I am grateful to be part of it.

p.strong: APS Ofrece desayunos, almuerzos y cenas GRATUITOS durante el cierre escolar extendido

hr.p: Durante el cierre escolar extendido de primavera, el distrito de las Escuelas Públicas de Aurora va a distribuir desayunos, almuerzos y cenas GRATUITOS. Estos alimentos serán distribuidos en 16 diferentes puntos de reparto. Las tres comidas, que incluyen opciones vegetarianas, estarán listas a través de un sistema práctico de recoger y llevar (grab-and-go). Gracias al generoso apoyo filantrópico, ahora podemos proporcionar alimentos para todos, incluyendo los adultos.

Los alimentos estarán disponibles de lunes a viernes, hasta el 17 de abril, en los siguientes sitios y horarios. APS está distribuyendo alimentos en el mayor número de puntos posibles para que las familias los tengan lo más cercanamente posible. Ustedes se darán cuenta de que los tiempos para recoger los alimentos duran 25 minutos. Aunque esto pueda parecer poco tiempo, creemos que estos tiempos nos permitirán distribuir los alimentos de manera rápida a través del sistema grab-and-go, a la vez que aprovechamos al máximo el número de puntos de reparto y damos servicio al mayor número de familias a lo largo del distrito.

p.span: Por favor identifiquen las horas de inicio para el punto de reparto más cercano a su hogar. A continuación encontrarán el

a.span: mapa de los puntos de distribución en Aurora

p.span: Si APS extiende el receso más allá del 27 de marzo, el distrito les comunicará los planes para la distribución de alimentos en ese momento. APS seguirá comunicándose a través de llamadas telefónicas, correos electrónicos y por medio de nuestra página de Internet:

p.b: Town Center at Aurora (Afuera de la zona de restaurantes/

img.data-image-title: APS Free Meal Program During Exrended Break flyer – Spanish updated 4

p.span: De acuerdo con la Ley Federal y las políticas del Departamento de Agricultura
esta institución tiene prohibido discriminar en base a raza, color, nacionalidad, género, edad o discapacidad.
es proveedora y empleadora de igualdad de oportunidades. Para obtener mayor información,
Además, la línea directa de Colorado para recursos de alimentos

es un número telefónico bilingüe y gratuito que pone en contacto a las personas de Colorado con lugares que ofrecen recursos de alimentos y nutrición. Llame a la línea telefónica de Colorado para recursos de alimentos al

720-382-2920. Está abierta de lunes a viernes de 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Si ustedes dejan mensajes de voz después de horas de operación, o durante el fin de semana, les regresarán la llamada al siguiente día hábil Messages left after-hours or on a weekend will be returned the next business day. (Para personas con dificultades de audición, llamar a
También hemos desarrollado esta hoja informativa,
. Estará disponible al hacer clic en el listón dedicado a COVID-19 en nuestra página de Internet:

Agradezco su paciencia y comprensión durante las últimas semanas. En tiempos como éstos, es indispensable que cada uno de nosotros hagamos nuestra parte para cuidarnos a nosotros mismos, a nuestras familias y a nuestra comunidad. La fuerza colectiva de la comunidad de APS me inspira cada día, y estoy muy agradecido de ser parte de ella.

span.strong: STUDENT DATA PRIVACY AND SECURITY ACT

p.span: The Aurora Public School District holds data privacy and security in high regard and takes action to ensure that our students’ data is handled securely in compliance with the Colorado Student Data Transparency and Security Act (HB 16-1423) and the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA).

The Aurora Public Schools is committed to the policy that all persons shall have equal access to its programs, facilities, and employment and does not discriminate on the basis of race, age, color, creed, national origin, sexual orientation (which includes transgender), conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth, disability, religion, ancestry, sex or need for special education services, or genetic information for employment and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. Career and technical education opportunities will be offered without regard to these protected classes. In adhering to this policy, the Aurora Public Schools abides by Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, the Americans with Disabilities Act, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Age Discrimination Act and Titles VI and VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964.

Questions, complaints or requests for additional information regarding these laws or issues concerning discrimination (including information about how to file a grievance if you believe you are the victim of discrimination) should be directed to the compliance officer for these issues, Megan Lonergan, or designee, 15701 E. 1st Avenue, Aurora, CO 80011, phone: 303-344-8060 x28771, malonergan@aurorak12.org. This notice is available in alternative forms.

span.strong: View District Policy AC regarding Nondiscrimination.
Read the full Notice of Nondiscrimination.

p.span: It is the goal of Aurora Public Schools that the information on this website be accessible to individuals with visual, hearing or cognitive disabilities.

If you are unable to access any page(s) in our site, please email the Aurora Public Schools Information Technology Service Desk. Please include the location of the webpage/document and your name, email address and telephone number so that we may contact you to provide the information in another format.
Please note that some pages on the Aurora Public Schools website contain links to third-party sites. APS is not responsible for the content, facts, opinions or accessibility of third-party sites.
Formal grievances regarding Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and/or Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act maybe filed pursuant to Policy AC and Regulation AC-R found here.

strong.span: Read the full Notice of Web Accessibility.
